item.title: Glenn add a quote by Nigella Lawson
item.description: "I don't believe you can ever really cook unless you love eating." -- Nigella Lawson

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Gregory David Roberts
item.description: "It took me a long time and most of the world to learn what I know about love and fate and the choices we make, but the heart of it came to me in an instant, while I was chained to a wall and being tortured.\" -- Gregory David Roberts

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Publilius Syrus
item.description: "Pain forces even the innocent to lie." -- Publilius Syrus

item.title: Glenn add a quote by China Miéville
item.description: "And the continual non-up-turnance of so valuable a commodity as a giant squid—the thought of getting their alembics on which made the city’s alchemists whine like dogs—was provoking more and more interest from London’s repo-men and -women." -- China Miéville

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you want me to give you a two-hour presentation, I am ready today. If you want only a five-minute speech, it will take me two weeks to prepare." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description:
"Marina brushed her hand across the back of her neck and dislodged something with a hard shell.
She had learned in time to brush instead of slap as slapping only served to pump the entire contents of the insect, which was doubtlessly already burrowed into the skin with some entomological protuberance, straight into the bloodstream." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Ernest Cline
item.description: "We lived in the Portland Avenue Stacks, a sprawling hive of discolored tin shoeboxes rusting on the shores of I-40, just west of Oklahoma City’s decaying skyscraper core." -- Ernest Cline
